column1: Smoque BBQ////Nothing much to say that hasn't been said by others. A few years ago
column2: I would have reviewed Smoque as the bomb because good bar-b-que was still hard to find on the north/northwest side. These days
column3: it holds up to its competitors (Rub's in my neighborhood). Brisket is the best choice and ribs come in a close second. Hand-cut fries and baked beans are delicious
column4: but other sides are pretty average. Be prepared to wait in line almost any evening
column5: but the staff works hard to keep everybody moving. Probably not the place if you're looking to linger over dinner.
